intro: Senecio faujasioides, commonly known as the Cape fujasioides, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Senecio faujasioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive floral display.
